name: Torrent Manager
short_description: A Python application for managing torrent client instances with a secure REST API and CLI.
long_description: Torrent Manager is a comprehensive Python application that provides unified control over multiple torrent clients (rTorrent and Transmission) through both a REST API and command-line interface. It features a web-based frontend for browser-based management, secure session-based and API key authentication, torrent activity logging and tracking, automated maintenance tasks (moving completed torrents, pausing long-seeded torrents), and database management for users, torrents, and activity. The application supports both local and remote torrent server connections with HTTP-based file serving and optional local mount support.

modules.description: Main FastAPI application setup with CORS middleware, static file serving, authentication management, and background tasks for seeding monitoring.
Abstract base class defining the interface for torrent client implementations, allowing RTorrentClient and TransmissionClient to be used interchangeably.
Factory for creating appropriate torrent client instances (RTorrentClient or TransmissionClient) based on server configuration.
Implementation of the rTorrent client connector using XML-RPC protocol for torrent operations.
Implementation of the Transmission client connector using Transmission RPC protocol for torrent operations.
Session-based authentication with sliding expiration windows, remember-me tokens, API key management, and bcrypt password hashing.
Peewee database models for users, sessions, API keys, torrent servers, torrents, status tracking, and activity logging.
Torrent file parser for extracting metadata, generating info hashes, creating magnet links, and managing tracker lists.
Magnet link parser and reconstructor for extracting and reconstructing magnet URIs with info hash, name, trackers, and size.
Activity tracking and logging system for recording torrent status, seeding duration, and other torrent events.
FastAPI routes for torrent management operations including listing, adding, starting, stopping, and removing torrents.
FastAPI routes for authentication endpoints including login, registration, logout, and API key management.
FastAPI routes for torrent server management including configuration, testing connections, and server listing.
Command-line interface providing terminal access to API functionality with session persistence and user authentication.
Configuration management with environment variable support, defaults for logging, database paths, seeding durations, and polling intervals.
